titles.title: To designate a site for the relocation of the public facility of the National Museum of Health and Medicine, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E927)

committee.name: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation

bill.summary: 4/28/1994--Introduced. Requires the public facility of the National Museum of Health and Medicine to be located on the following adjacent areas of Federal land in the District of Columbia: (1) the east plaza of the Hubert Humphrey Building, presently occupied by the Department of Health and Human Services; (2) the entire portion of 2nd Street, Southwest, that is located between C Street and Washington Avenue, Southwest; and (3) a triangular park, known as Square N-580, which lies immediately to the east of 2nd Street, Southwest. Authorizes the Administrator of General Services to apply for the closing and transfer of jurisdiction over the latter two areas, from the District to the General Services Administration for the purpose of locating the Museum.
